meanings.definition: To restore to a former better state (verb)
meanings.sent1: She renovates her old house to make it look new again.
meanings.sent2: The company renovates old buildings to preserve their history.
meanings.sent3: The cat renovates its favorite toy by adding new feathers to it.
meanings.sent4: Time renovates memories, making them seem brighter than they were.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth renovates the frozen landscape, bringing life back to it.

meanings.sent1: He renovates antique furniture to bring out its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The school renovates the playground equipment to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The robot renovates itself with shiny new parts, looking brand new.
meanings.sent4: Laughter renovates the spirit, lifting it up from sadness.
meanings.sent5: Music has the power to renovate the soul, filling it with joy.
